ngiemboon: M bɔ́ɔnte ńgyá tsɔ̌ nkʉ̀ʼʉ pà nɔ̀ɔn fó tsɛ̀ɛ ntse tépàa ńkẅɛ, ńgẅiin metwó sɔɔnmbʉ́a, ńgẅiin mendóŋ legém, yɛ̌ yɛ̌ ndóŋ wɔ́ɔ gẅiin cÿɔ̀ʼɔ lefùɔ, mbà mé ŋweʼé lezíŋ sie mé lɔgɔ ńzoonte Ssé zoonte á na yɛ̌ yɛ̌ twó yé wɔ́ɔ.
en: And I saw a beast coming up out of the sea.   It had ten horns and seven heads. On its horns were ten crowns,  # 13:1 Or diadems,# 13:1 Rv 12:3 and on its heads were blasphemous names.  # 13:1 Other mss read heads was a blasphemous name,# 13:1 Rv 17:3

ngiemboon: Nɔ̀ɔn gẅie n da gyá, à la gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ ŋɔ̀ɔnŋʉ́, mekwò mé gwɔ́ páʼ me tsɔ̌ máamáa tsò, encwò wé gwɔ́ páʼ we púʼntʉ̀. Máamáa nnúngém wa ná metʉ̀ mé mbwó yé, ńnáa lʉŋe lefùɔ yé né yé, ńnyé lésáʼ pʉ̀a mbwó yé#13:2 Nda 7:3-6.
en: The beast I saw was like a leopard, its feet were like a bear’s, and its mouth was like a lion’s mouth.   The dragon gave the beast his power, his throne, and great authority.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tàʼ na twó sé la gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ fʉ̀ʼ gie mé ka néŋ fʉ̌ŋ mǒ tà ngwɔ́ é zẅé yé zẅé la, tá fʉ̌ŋ ŋwɛ́ gie e kɔ̌ɔn ngwɔ́ gie ngwɔ́ é zẅé yé zẅé gwɔ́ mbà e kéen ńtʉ. Epʉ̀a ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ gyá púʼu, ḿbú ḿmɔɔn, ńzẅɛ ńcʉ́me nzèm nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́.
en: One of its heads appeared to be fatally wounded, but its fatal wound was healed.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò nnúngém ya, á nue à ka nyé lésáʼ pʉ̀a á mbwó nɔ̀ɔn, ńne ńŋwɔ́ʼɔ nnɛ́ mvfò nɔ̀ɔn, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Awɔ̌ gẅiin tʉ̀ páʼ nɔ̀ɔn? Ńgwɔ́ wɔ̌ maʼa yé lé ncù?»
en: They worshiped the dragon   because he gave authority to the beast. And they worshiped the beast, saying, “Who is like the beast?  # 13:4 Ex 15:11; Is 46:5 Who is able to wage war against it? ”

ngiemboon: Mé ná ncwò gẅie à ge lɔg fwɔʼte meshwóŋè ngwág, mbɔɔ páʼ à ge lɔg zoonte Ssé né yé, ńnyé yé páʼ à ge sáʼ sé lefùɔ á na mesaŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a lé móm lekùɔ.
en: The beast was given a mouth to utter boasts and blasphemies.   It was allowed to exercise authority  # 13:5 Other mss read to wage war,# 13:5 Or to rule for forty-two months.  # 13:5 Rv 11:2

ngiemboon: Nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́ zye léshwóŋo té poŋ na Ssé, ńzoonte lezíŋ Ssé, ńzoonte jʉʼ gie e Ssé néŋe wó, ńzoonte mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie é néŋe tÿǒ lepwó.
en: It began to speak   blasphemies against God: to blaspheme his name and his dwelling #— #those who dwell in heaven.

ngiemboon: Mé nyé yé ngie à gʉa ḿmaʼ pʉ̀a Ssé lé ncù maʼ tà ńcʉa wɔ́b, ńnyé yé ngie à sáʼ mengẅɛ̀ ntsèm, ngie à sáʼ pʉ̀a ntí ntí, ngie à sáʼ pashwóŋo meshwóŋè ntí ntí, ngie à sáʼ mengwòŋ ntsèm.
en: And it was permitted to wage war against the saints and to conquer them.   It was also given authority  # 13:7 Jr 27:6; Dn 7:6,14; Lk 4:6; Jn 19:11 over every tribe, people, language, and nation.  # 13:7 Rv 5:9; 7:9; 11:9; 14:6

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a metsèm pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ ge gÿo é ŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò yé, é guʼte yé. Mé gɔɔn ngwòŋ pʉ̀a metsèm pie mé la te ŋweʼe lezíŋ sɔ́b á tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne legwɔ́ wó, tà fó fʉ̀ʼ gie njÿó la zye wɔ́. Aŋwàʼne ŋwɛ́ áa ye múɔ njʉ̀njÿò gẅie mé la zẅé.
en: All those who live on the earth will worship it, everyone whose name was not written from the foundation of the world in the book   of life  # 13:8 Ex 32:32–33; Ps 69:28; Php 4:3; Rv 3:5; 17:8; 20:12,15; 21:27 of the Lamb who was slaughtered.  # 13:8 Or written in the book of life of the Lamb who was slaughtered from the foundation of the world,# 13:8 1Pt 1:19–20; Rv 5:6,12; 7:14

ngiemboon: «Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin metuŋó lélɔg ńjúʼu nò, á júʼ.
en: If anyone has ears to hear, let him listen.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gẅie mé la záb ngie à ge láʼ gwɔ́ puʼu ncù, mbà à ge láʼ gwɔ́ pɔ́ yɛ̌. Nyìŋ gẅie mé la záb ngie mé ge láʼ lɔg nně ncù, é zẅé yé, mé ge láʼ lɔg pɔ́ yɛ̌ é zẅé yé. Yɔɔn nò lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie epʉ̀a pie ée pe Ssé, é gẅiin léshÿɔg, ńké ńne ńzába pɔ́ ntʉ́m na Ssé.»
en: If anyone is to be taken captive,

ngiemboon: M biŋ ńgyá wetsɔ̌ nkʉ̀ʼʉ nɔ̀ɔn ne fóo tsɛ̀ɛ tsetsáʼ ńkẅɛɛ. Mendóŋ mé gwɔ́ mémbʉ́a páʼ me múɔ Njʉ̀njÿò, tá á ne ńgɔɔn nò páʼ máamáa nnúngém la.
en: Then I saw another beast coming up out of the earth; it had two horns like a lamb,  ,# 13:11 Dn 8:3 but it spoke like a dragon.

ngiemboon: À la gẅiin metʉ̀ ndùŋmvfò nɔ̀ɔn, lélɔg ńgÿo menò, á na lezíŋ sé, ńne ńgÿo mânyìŋ ntsèm ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ ŋwɔ́ʼɔ nnɛ́ mvfò ndùŋmvfò nɔ̀ɔn, ńguʼte yé. Á nɔ̀ɔn wa gẅie fʉ̌ŋ laa na yé tà ngwɔ́ pɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ é zẅé yé zẅě ḿbiŋ ńtʉ la.
en: It exercises all the authority of the first beast on its behalf and compels the earth and those who live on it to worship the first beast, whose fatal wound was healed.

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn nɔ̀ɔn mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a pú ńgÿo memǎa menò mɔɔnmɔɔn, tà ńgÿo emmɔ̌g fó tÿǒ lepwó ésẅɛ́ʼɛ ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, mânyìŋ ntsèm tyé ńne ńgyá.
en: It also performs great signs,   even causing fire to come down from heaven to earth in front of people.  # 13:13 1Kg 18:38; 2Kg 1:10; Lk 9:54

ngiemboon: Á lɔg páʼ mé la náa yé metʉ̀ lélɔg ńgÿo menò mɔɔnmɔɔn á na lezíŋ wetsɔ̌ nɔ̀ɔn wa, ńdÿɔgte pʉ̀a mesoŋ pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, ngie pɔ́ pwóon tútú gẅie à sẅé nɔ̀ɔn gẅie mé la lɔg nně ncù ńnéŋ fʉ̌ŋ na yé tá à te kwé la, ńdɔg ńguʼte yé.
en: It deceives those who live on the earth   because of the signs that it is permitted to perform in the presence of the beast,  # 13:14 2Th 2:9–12; Rv 19:20 telling those who live on the earth to make an image  # 13:14 Or a statue, or a likeness of the beast who was wounded by the sword and yet lived.

ngiemboon: Mé gíŋ ńnáa yé metʉ̀ páʼ à ge gÿo tútú gẅie mé lɔ̌g fʉʼte nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́, à ŋele, ńzsé ngie tútú ŋwɛ́ ge kuʼu légɔɔn nò, é kuʼu lézẅéte pʉ̀a metsèm pie é kaa zẅíŋe léŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò yé tútú wɔ́.
en: It was permitted to give breath   to the image of the beast, so that the image of the beast could both speak and cause whoever would not worship the image of the beast to be killed.  # 13:15 Dn 3:5–6; Rv 20:4

ngiemboon: Nɔ̀ɔn we mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a gÿo na ntí gie wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ, ge gẅiin liŋé na pwó yé kà na zǐ yé wɔ́ɔ. Tà mbɔɔ páʼ à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ pɔ́ mênkʉ́, á ndÿò, á ngàŋa mmó, á mbóŋ, á ndùnnɛ́, á nkwɔɔn.
en: And it makes everyone #— #small and great, rich and poor, free and slave #— #to receive a mark on his right hand or on his forehead,

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ngwɔ́ á le júu mmó, kà sẅiŋe mmó sẅiŋ wɔ́ɔ té gwɔ́ gie à gẅiin yɛ̌ liŋé gie ée lezíŋ ndùŋmvfò nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́, ńgíŋe ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ menómbà mie é cúʼte ńgwɔ́ lezíŋ sé wɔ́.
en: so that no one can buy or sell unless he has the mark: the beast’s name or the number of its name.

ngiemboon: Anò gie mé gee ńgɔɔn fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, á zɛ́te ngie nyìŋ lɔgɔ zsénò tá ńjúʼ. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin legye á liŋ menómbà mie é cúʼte ńdɔgɔ ńdaʼte lezíŋ nɔ̀ɔn. Eyɛ̌ nómbà lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ lezíŋ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ mesoŋ, ee nómbà ntsɔ̀b ntɔgɔ́ lé móm ntɔgɔ́ nzèm nkÿo ntɔgɔ́ (666).
en: This calls for wisdom:  ,# 13:18 Rv 17:9 Let the one who has understanding calculate  # 13:18 Or count, or figure out the number of the beast, because it is the number of a person. Its number is 666.  # 13:18 Other Gk mss read 616
